H0.text: Body hair is what humans and bats physically have in common.

H1.text: Wing size is what humans and bats have physically in common.

H2.text: Gland hair is something that humans and bats have physically in common.

H3.text: Body odor is a physical characteristic shared by humans and bats.

A4.text: Humans evolved by natural selection to be hairless when the trade off of having fewer parasites became more important than having a warming, furry coat.

A5.text: The two main advantages are bipedal locomotion and greater thermal load dissipation capacity due to better sweating and less hair.

A6.text: Hairs can sense movements of air as well as touch by physical objects and they provide sensory awareness of the presence of ectoparasites.

A7.text: The text describes human body hair loss and function but does not mention bat body hair.

A8.text: Bats are the only mammals capable of true and sustained flight.

A9.text: Most mammals also have hair to help keep them warm.
